desc:
Ribbon and Sparky have the same birthday, though Ribbon was two years older than Sparky. Ribbon showed Sparky the ropes around Hillslope, taught her to cook and bake, and asked her to investigate the attack on [Starry](../starry/). Sparky was about to take all the caring she gave her for granted. She couldn't have been more mistaken.

> Gratitude gets you far, Sparky. Very far.
Sparky and Qibli became friends through [Sky](/characters/sky/). She is always trying to pull Qibli out of her own world and make her hang out with Sky and [Firecrackers](/characters/firecrackers/).

Sparky got assigned to sit next to Sky on their first day of [Middle School](/world/bauhinia/coastline/cms/). The stuff he did -- twirl cards, take photos, being able to recognize any sort of tank at one glance -- fascinated her. Though she wouldn't admit it, she had a little crush on him. The crush later turned to a big crush on [Nightsun](/characters/nightsun/).

As for Sky, he is always looking for new friends.
What's the difference between their cursing? Sparky does it unconsiously; she treats curses like like normal words. But Firecrackers curses intentionally, just to piss people off.
Sparky loves Amber almost obsessively. Amber seems to be more focused on [Willow](../willow/), however.

Peacock is Sparky's step-father ~~and reincarnation~~. Sparky hates him because he didn't match up to the perfect father (Jackal) in her mind.

Peacock, on the other hand, is deep in conflict as he both hates who he was in the past, but also desperately wants to *be* who he was in the past.
Sparky and Ironheart are locked in an eternal childish sibling rivalry despite growing into adults.
Sparky and Willow have the [same mother](/characters/amber/) but different fathers. Willow is the one who understands Sparky the most, because of her mind-reading.

They're both bisexual and deep in the closet. They both know the other is bisexual. They're both trying all sorts of gimmicks to make the other come out.

---

Nightsun used to be a no-names [Starcorp](/world/bauhinia/starcorp/) employee in the headquarters in Coastline. Sparky developed a huge crush on him and kept trying to get close to him despite warnings from Animus. After [Fantasy](/characters/fantasy/) and [Bramble](/characters/bramble/) became her child, she proposed to Nightsun and they got married.

Once they got married, Sparky started to exert control over him like she did everyone. She made Nightsun quit his job and stay at home to take care of . He did, so now Bramble likes him ("papa!") more than he likes Sparky ("auntie"), and now she's mad about it.

Little did she know, Nightsun was a spy sent to get information on Animus. After Animus found out, Sparky refused to let anything happen to Nightsun because she still loved him, and believed that he reciprocated, and also Bramble liked him too much. Animus decided to feed false information through Nightsun. Sparky thought she might be able to turn him around.

Nightsun might have loved Sparky too, at one point. But the lack of progress on his mission and the suffocating feeling he had whenever he was around her made it difficult for him to view Sparky in a positive light. He only cared about her because if she died his mission would fail.

Bramble still refers to Sparky as his aunt even when he calls [Nightsun](/characters/nightsun/) his dad. Sparky is really mad about it. She really did care about Bramble. Now I wonder where I've seen this before... Ah yes, Sparky calling Peacock "Peacock."

Bramble also constantly pesters Sparky into telling him what happened to [his mom](/characters/fantasy/), because "Auntie knows *everything*!" Truth is, Sparky would also very much like to know what happened to Fantasy.

Sparky took care of Pearl like she's her daughter. However, as they ran out of money and was struggling to move forward in [Sylvandia](/world/sylvandia/), she found herself also looking at Pearl and seeing not a person, but a machine for producing pearls.

Sparky and Devotion have the exact same pistol so they always have fights about whose pistol is better. They are. Exactly. The. Same. Colt 1911 (didn't the [industrial revolution](/world/history/) *just* break out in 1911? Whatever I don't care). But apparently Devotion's gun is retired from the military while Sparky's is bought off the civilian market.

Sparky and Elegance are good friends. There was this time when Elegance was kidnapped, and Sparky refused to leave her side, so she got kidnapped with her.

Sparky's superstrength distorts Elegance's perception of time, though they didn't know this at first.
Tundra loves Ribbon's baking.

Ribbon has a huge crush on Starry. (Before he got knocked out, or it's gonna be creepy.) After he went into the coma, Ribbon took his room key and took care of him, keeping him alive every day by jamming water and soup down his throat with a funnel. If Starry wasn't aware of her crush before, he certainly is now.
Cosmo and Tomato hate each other for some reason. Mainly, Cosmo is always trying to get Tomato to run errands for her and Tomato's getting fed up.

Jerboa gets ordered around by Tephra, mainly because Tephra promised to help him find his parents.

He did help in the end, though, by introducing Jerboa to [Frosting](/characters/frosting/), who showed him the [Project Boomerang](/world/bauhinia/project-boomerang/) files. But that was ages later. Tephra's just a mean boss and Jerboa's his doormat.
Dragonfly told [Sparky](/characters/sparky/) that Melody and him were the same person.
Jerboa faintly remembers playing dolls with Jaculus. She is also in the family photo he doesn't remember taking.
Jerboa doesn't have memories of his mom. His only proof of her existence is a family photo he doesn't remember taking.
Jerboa doesn't have memories of his dad. His only proof of his existence is a family photo he doesn't remember taking.

Frosting and Jerboa met through [Tephra](/characters/tephra/) because of his promise to help Jerboa find his family.

Frosting risked her job letting Jerboa look through the archives, partly because she was bored as fuck and partly because she thought that by having Jerboa find out the truth, she was giving her dear friend Jaculus a proper closure too.

Qibli and Sky have known each other since kindergarten. Their parents, Donut and Dazzle, are colleagues, which is why they often put Qibli and Sky together. Embarrasingly, they used to say they wanted to marry each other when they grew up. They no longer want to do that.

They're both nerdy as fuck, but Sky thinks it's cool while Qibli thinks she is boring. Sky would try all sort of things to convince her being nerdy is cool.
Goose's first very own apprentice is Sky.
Fantasy and Ironheart have the [same father](/characters/peacock/) but different mothers.
Fantasy and Willow have the [same father](/characters/peacock/) but different mothers.
Bramble doesn't remember many things about his mom, but he remembers enough to say "Auntie is mean, I love mama."
Willow and Ironheart have the [same father](/characters/peacock/) but different mothers.

Nightsun spends most of his time around Bramble after he quit his job after marrying [Sparky](/characters/sparky/). So naturally, Bramble likes him more. Nightsun, however, hates kids. He's just to scared to show it in front of Sparky.

Bramble thinks his papa is the best chef in the world.

Pumpkin and Goose are on the same team in the MSS, both on the younger side. They have a very pure and goofy friendship, always willing to help each other out, and always ready to laugh at each other when they did something stupid (which is often).
Paperweight is constantly annoyed that Goose didn't live up to his expectations.

Paperweight hates Pumpkin because he's so annoying. Also because he's jealous at how Pumpkin was smarter and stronger than him. And that he's mad at himself for growing old.

Also he think's Pumpkin is a weirdo because Paperweight is homophobic as fuck.
Chastity would often threaten to slice up Elegance's plushies with her chainsaw.
Jaculus and Frosting were one of the few kids in the [Project Boomerang)(/world/bauhinia/project-boomerang/) laboratory, so they were natually close to each other.
Koala and Kangaroo met each other while studying physics in [Moreland](/world/moreland/).
